programme.desc: JOLLY CANDIES: Girls and boys, shhh‚Ä¶! Stop that noise!Hear the tender voice that tells a story and listen to the beautiful songs of glory! DANCING MONSTERS:Motion to dynamics, dynamics to passion! Body are shaking, rhythm quaking, wonder making Dancing Monsters!

programme.title: Lolly Kids Stars: Teen Dream / Children's Songs
programme.desc: TEEN DREAM: Our talented teenagers create their own music and lyrics guided by their own heart. Finding the first love, chasing the big dream, living the good life and having the best friends. Hear all that and much more.TIME TO SHINE:The coldest songs that get stuck in your head. programme.title: Dream Pursuers: Dream Are Made Of You / Magic World
programme.desc: DREAMS ARE MADE OF YOU: Music has tremendous power. Recreate your world with music! Discover your talents, inspiration, emotions, create discipline and professionalism. MAGIC WORLD:Meeting children musicians and performers from all around the world. Every place, religion, and race! No matter where you are, we all share one common language - music.

programme.desc: FUTURE HITS: A Variety of styles, following the modern kids' lifestyle. Amazing concerts and music videos. Dare to sing and dance and be with your idols non-stop. LITTLE ROCK TITANS:Rock and shake,and shake and rock! Mood is high, Blood is hot! Here's the party - make a shotand be just part of our show!

programme.title: Heartland Docs, DVM
programme.desc: Spring has sprung, but a snowstorm hits Nebraska, forcing the Drs. Erin and Ben Schroeder to contend with unpredictable weather. Despite the snow, springtime for the docs means helping to bring new life into the world, whether its doing a pregnancy check on a herd of 200 cattle; artificially inseminating a German shorthair dog; or wrangling a potentially pregnant pot-bellied pig.

programme.title: Heartland Docs, DVM
programme.desc: Ahead of the hometown rodeo, Drs. Erin and Ben Schroeder make sure the star animals are healthy and ready for the big rodeo. When hes not avoiding a charging bull, Dr. Ben bonds with his two sons while caring for an underdeveloped calf and a snake that wont eat. Dr. Erin is filled with emotion as she cares for a pup with tumors whose owner passed away and for a cat with a shocking leg injury.

programme.title: Africa's Deadliest
programme.desc: Southern Africa‚Äôs Bushveld region is home to the icons of the African continent. It‚Äôs an untamed wilderness where ancient battles for survival play out on a grand scale. Governed by the turning of the seasons, it‚Äôs a place of the big hitters of the natural world and eternal enemies must savagely fight for their right to rule using brute strength, speed, agility or cunning to claim their place at the top.

programme.title: Heartland Docs, DVM
programme.desc: Early spring in Nebraska brings new life and unpredictable veterinary challenges for Drs. Erin and Ben Schroeder as they treat a cow‚Äôs prolapsed uterus, diagnose a deadly intestinal disease and perform a canine C-section with sons Charlie and Chase assisting. The vets also tend to an injured wild owl, a sheep too weak to stand and a litter of cats with ear mites.

programme.title: Desert Lions: Surviving At Skeleton Coast
programme.desc: In this true story, lion researcher Dr. Philip Stander follows three orphaned lion cubs from birth to adulthood as they navigate the complexity of survival in one of the world's most unforgiving environments, Namibia‚Äôs deadly Skeleton Coast. He gets up close and personal to unlock secrets of their world and witness the amazing adaptability of these special cats.

programme.title: Ultimate Animals Compilations
programme.desc: Tigers have the strength of 13 men and their tongue has teeth. Polar bears can regenerate their own bones and may provide a cure for diabetes..

programme.title: Ultimate Animals Compilations
programme.desc: Raccoons can scale tall objects by changing the shape of their skeletons and the octopus pumps its blood with three hearts..

programme.title: Snakes In The City
programme.desc: Snake catcher Simon Keys and herpetologist, Siouxsie Gillett's business poses life and death situations. Every capture has its dangers, from an almost fatal mamba attack to the risks of being buried under a collapsing house with a snake.

programme.title: Okavango: River Of Dreams

programme.title: Malika: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: Narrated by Hollywood A-Lister actress Angela Bassett and produced by the Emmy-Award-winning producers of Planet Earth II, Blue Planet, and Hostile Planet, we journey with Malika as she deals with the hardships of moving from childhood to adulthood. The lioness must learn to hunt and help protect the pride from deadly intruders.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol has helped kids show animals at the county fair for more than 40 years. For some families, its a tradition going back generations. Raising fair animals takes months of work, and it all pays off at showtime! At the clinic, Doc helps a limping steer with a swollen leg, Dr. Brenda treats a urinary blockage that threatens a cats kidneys, and Dr. Lisa bandages a wounded dog.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol searches for clues to why a python has lumps under her skin. Dr. Nicole discovers the surprising cause of a cat‚Äôs sky-high fever, and Dr. Lisa sutures a dog‚Äôs puncture wound. In the parking lot, alpacas get their shots and a goose gets loose. Dr. Pol is asked by a local baseball team to throw out the first pitch. To warm up his arm, Dr. Pol plays catch with Charles and Abigail.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: With an ultrasound for a bearded dragon and wound care for a goose, the to-do list never ends. Dr. Lisa has back-to-back pup emergencies. Dr. Pol and Dr. Brenda team up to answer an emergency farm call, and Dr. Nicole gives TLC to a stray kitty. While the clinic staff takes care of business in MI, Dr. Pol proudly escorts U.S. veterans to Washington, D.C. with the Mid-Michigan Honor Flight.

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Zoologist Jack Randall journeys into Australia‚Äôs remote Northern Territory to encounter six dangerous pythons, including the rare Oenpelli. Along the way, Jack dives into crocodile-infested swamps, reaches into giant lizard burrows, dodges the bite of a deadly venomous snake and crawls into cramped, dark caves to find these elusive predators.

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Wildlife zoologist Jack Randall travels into Australia‚Äôs untamed Northern Territory to the battle between two species of deadly crocodiles where the massive saltwater crocs are overrunning their smaller freshwater cousins. Jack helps local experts and scientists catch and track these living dinosaurs in the hopes of maintaining nature‚Äôs balance.

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Wildlife zoologist Jack Randall journeys deep into the Australian outback to fulfill his lifelong dream of being accepted into a ‚Äúmob‚Äù of wild kangaroos. Along the way, Jack snatches up snakes, lunges after lizards, defends against dangerous dingoes and even rescues an orphaned baby kangaroo.

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Fearless wildlife zoologist Jack Randall dives head first into a marine mystery: are majestic green sea turtles adapting to the devastating conditions of Australia‚Äôs dying Great Barrier Reef? While joining forces with a dedicated team of daring scientists, Jack dodges bull rays, snatches nurse sharks and wrangles dugongs.

programme.title: Out There With Jack Randall
programme.desc: Zoologist Jack Randall explores Australia‚Äôs remote Cape York peninsula to confront five of the most venomous snakes in the world, including the elusive Coastal Taipan. Along the way, Jack encounters huge pythons and terrifying tarantulas and joins forces with a local wildlife legend to determine which is the deadliest snake ‚Äúdown under.‚Äù.

programme.title: Lions: The Hunt For Survival
programme.desc: Three lionesses from three very different hunting arenas. Each face their own challenges, but all gun for one clear goal - to kill..

programme.title: Savage Kingdom
programme.desc: Matsumi, has ascended to become Queen of the Marsh Pride. An unrivalled hunter, she has yet to prove herself as the leader of the dynasty that controls the beating heart of her Savage Kingdom the Great Marsh. Her rivals and The Kingdoms brutal climate do everything they can to bring her clan to its knees. Will the price of success be too high for the Marsh Pride to pay?.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild India
programme.desc: At first glance the desert of India's north-west appear devoid of life. But even in the most hostile environments wildlife thrives. In this inhospitable place, only the best adapted survive. Here, in the harsh deserts and salty drylands, live India's specialists. They have to endure extreme hardship, sandstorms, droughts, and intense heat.

programme.title: Land Of The Iberian Lynx
programme.desc: Spring rains bring new opportunities and hope to the land of the Iberian lynx. But for the female lynxes of the valley, it is always a challenge to raise their cubs. programme.title: Africa's Deadliest
programme.desc: Vital to the survival of many species, waterholes draw large concentrations of animals seeking to quench their thirst. But these wildlife hotspots are anything but peaceful oases ‚Äî where there is water, Africa‚Äôs deadliest are often nearby.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol performs emergency surgery on a dog that swallowed a rope toy. Dr. Nicole examines a tiny kitten with a big eye problem, and Dr. Lisa helps a horse suffering from heaves. A fungal infection glows on a Pomeranian while a lump grows on a Pitbull. The Pols celebrate their 55th wedding anniversary with cake decorated by grandkids, Silas and Abigail.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol treats three bovines and one tiny rabbit before heading to the Netherlands with Diane to celebrate his 80th birthday. Just because the Docs away, it doesnt mean that the clinic slows down. A very vocal pig needs surgery to treat a hernia, a blocked cat is in pain and requires immediate relief, and a puppy is feeling the effects of eating something inedible. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol has helped kids show animals at the county fair for more than 40 years. For some families, its a tradition going back generations. Raising fair animals takes months of work, and it all pays off at showtime! At the clinic, Doc helps a limping steer with a swollen leg, Dr. Brenda treats a urinary blockage that threatens a cats kidneys, and Dr. Lisa bandages a wounded dog.

programme.title: Tree Kangaroos: Ghosts Of The Forest
programme.desc: One of Australia's most extraordinary creatures, we trek through the lush rainforests of north Queensland to go inside the intimate and remarkable lives of the elusive Lumholtz tree kangaroo.

programme.title: Russia's Wild Tiger
programme.desc: RUSSIA'S WILD TIGER records the battle for survival of the big cats and reveals intimate details of their lives. The animals they prey on are also in the film: tigers couldn‚Äôt survive without sika deer, Altai wapiti, wild boars and Asian black bears. A young tiger, born in a conservation area, will guide the viewer through the film. RUSSIA'S WILD TIGER accompanies him throughout the year after he leaves his mother.

programme.title: Dragons Uncovered
programme.desc: The Komodo Dragon has captured our imaginations for over a century, yet so much about this incredible lizard remains a mystery. A creature with survival skills and physical characteristics seen in apex predators across the animal kingdom, and the ability to take down predators ten times its size. The secrets of the Komodo Dragon are revealed.

programme.title: Amur Tiger: Secret Kingdom
programme.desc: In the remote reaches of northeast China, lie vast forests - the realm of the Amur tiger. One of the planet‚Äôs rarest predators, Amur tigers roam the land in search of food and mates, while sharing their territory with many other iconic creatures, like the Amur leopard and the Asiatic black bear. Immersed in a rich and fragile ecosystem, these magnificent felines adapt their fortunes as the seasons change.

programme.title: Lion Brothers: Cubs To Kings
programme.desc: With his brother's help, Mtima faces the trials of life and learns the true meaning power and leadership to become the King he's always dreamed he'd be.

programme.title: Wild Transylvania: Dracula'S Hidden Kingdom
programme.desc: Dracula‚Äôs Transylvania lair is brimming with amazing wildlife. Shielded by the Carpathian Mountains, it‚Äôs a pristine wonderland that remains unchanged since the Middle Ages. Home to 26 species of bats, his kingdom is truly a night flyer‚Äôs paradise. Chamois, cuckoos, Ural owls, wild boar, lynx, brown bears, and huge wolf packs also thrive in a natural world beyond Bram Stoker‚Äôs imagination.

programme.title: Austria's Wild Heritage - One Country Six National
programme.desc: The first part explains the beginnings of the national parks in Austria, which were characterized by the visions of a few pioneers and the civil disobedience of many. One remembers the occupation of a floodplain in the conflict over the construction of a power station or protests against building a cannon firing range. But of course, this production also knows how to inspire with fascinating nature stories and animal shots. .

programme.title: Austria's Wild Heritage - One Country Six National
programme.desc: The second part focuses on the challenges of the future: How do the national parks deal with invasive species from outside and what success stories can be reported? For instance, in the Hohe Tauern National Park the previously extinct ibexes and bearded vultures have been reintroduced. In the Ges√§use National Park Avalanches created one of the most species-rich habitats, which rare butterflies like the Red Apollo colonize.
